title: Clutch Fluid Level Inspection

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
In accordance with the scheduled maintenance chart, inspect the clutch fluid level in the master cylinder reservoir.
The clutch fluid level must be kept between the upper and lower level lines (reservoir held horizontal).
Clean the reservoir cap before removing.
Remove the reservoir cap and the diaphragm seal.
Fill the reservoir to the upper level line using new DOT 4 fluid from a sealed container.
Refit the reservoir cap ensuring that the diaphragm seal is correctly positioned between the cap and the reservoir body.
Refit the two fixings and tighten to

search: Clutch Fluid Level Inspection
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
In accordance with the scheduled maintenance chart, inspect the clutch fluid level in the master cylinder reservoir.
The clutch fluid level must be kept between the upper and lower level lines (reservoir held horizontal).
Clutch Fluid Level Adjustment
Clean the reservoir cap before removing.
Remove the two fixings.
Remove the reservoir cap and the diaphragm seal.
Fill the reservoir to the upper level line using new DOT 4 fluid from a sealed container.
Refit the reservoir cap ensuring that the diaphragm seal is correctly positioned between the cap and the reservoir body.
Refit the two fixings and tighten to
1.5 Nm

Plastic plate
